text:
You climb until the winds scream like ghosts through jagged obsidian spires. The rock beneath your feet shifts and pulses—veins of dormant flame faintly glow just beneath the surface, like an old heart still trying to beat. Towers of twisted basalt reach skyward, broken by ancient explosions or long-dead wyrms.

At the summit, you glimpse far-off kingdoms wrapped in ash. Somewhere below, you hear a low, slow groaning—stone grinding against stone. The Peaks are not empty. They slumber, and slumbering things do not take kindly to trespass.
lore: The Obsidian Peaks were formed when the Fire-Daughters sundered the Skyforge. What they created could not die, only sleep. Beneath every crag, a memory stirs—one that remembers the betrayal of flame.
